places.name: Annapurna Base Camp
places.description: Spectacular mountain sanctuary surrounded by the towering peaks of the Annapurna massif.
places.detail: The Annapurna Base Camp (4,130m) sits in a natural amphitheater of snow-capped giants including Annapurna I (8,091m) and Machapuchare (6,993m). The trek passes through diverse landscapes from rice terraces to alpine meadows.

details.subtitle: First Ascent
details.text: Annapurna I was first climbed in 1950 - the first 8,000m peak ever summited

details.subtitle: Sacred Mountain
details.text: Machapuchare (Fishtail) remains unclimbed as it's considered sacred to Lord Shiva

details.subtitle: Trekking Hub
details.text: One of Nepal's most popular trekking destinations

details.subtitle: Conservation
details.text: Part of Annapurna Conservation Area (largest protected area in Nepal)

highlights: Natural hot springs at Jhinu Danda
travelTips: Acclimatize properly to avoid altitude sickness
Hire local guides from ACMC-registered companies

places.name: Pokhara (Lakeside)
places.description: Nepal's adventure capital nestled beside Phewa Lake with stunning Himalayan views.
places.detail: Pokhara serves as gateway to the Annapurna region. The lakeside area offers relaxed cafes, adventure sports, and breathtaking views of the Annapurna range reflected in Phewa Lake's waters.

details.subtitle: Ancient Trade Route
details.text: Was part of important salt trade route between Tibet and India

details.subtitle: Tourism Development
details.text: Became popular with hippies in 1960s-70s before evolving into adventure hub

details.subtitle: Adventure Tourism
details.text: Center for paragliding, zip-lining, and trekking

details.subtitle: Cultural Fusion
details.text: Blend of Gurung culture and international influences

travelTips: Visit Tal Barahi Temple by boat
Enjoy live music at Lakeside cafes

places.name: Muktinath Temple
places.description: Sacred pilgrimage site for both Hindus and Buddhists at 3,710m altitude.
places.detail: This ancient temple complex features 108 water spouts and eternal flames fed by natural gas. The site represents the harmony between Hinduism (Vishnu shrine) and Buddhism (Gompa).

details.subtitle: Ancient Origins
details.text: Mentioned in Hindu scriptures as 'Muktikshetra' (place of liberation)

details.subtitle: Trade History
details.text: Was important stop on Tibet-Nepal-India salt trade route

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Tourism
details.text: Receives over 100,000 pilgrims annually

details.subtitle: Geological Wonder
details.text: Natural gas flames and water at high altitude intrigue scientists

places.name: Manaslu Circuit
places.description: Challenging trek around the world's eighth highest mountain (8,163m).
places.detail: The 177km circuit offers dramatic Himalayan scenery, Tibetan-influenced culture, and fewer crowds than Annapurna. The route crosses Larkya La pass (5,106m) with views of Manaslu and Himalchuli peaks.

details.subtitle: First Ascent
details.text: Manaslu first climbed in 1956 by Japanese expedition

details.subtitle: Restricted Access
details.text: Area opened to trekkers only in 1991

details.subtitle: Sustainable Tourism
details.text: Model for low-impact trekking with limited permits

details.subtitle: Cultural Preservation
details.text: Protects traditional Tibetan Buddhist culture

places.name: Begnas Lake
places.description: Serene freshwater lake offering peaceful alternative to Pokhara's Phewa.
places.detail: The second largest lake in Pokhara Valley, Begnas remains less touristy while offering beautiful views of the Annapurna range. The area is known for its fish farms and traditional Nepali village life.

details.subtitle: Geological Formation
details.text: Formed by tectonic activity like all Pokhara valley lakes

details.subtitle: Agricultural Importance
details.text: Supports rice cultivation and fish farming for centuries

details.subtitle: Eco-Tourism
details.text: Developing as sustainable tourism destination

details.subtitle: Scientific Study
details.text: Important site for limnological research

travelTips: Stay in homestays for authentic experience
Combine with hike to Panchase Hill

places.name: Ghandruk
places.description: Picture-perfect Gurung village with stunning Annapurna views.
places.detail: This traditional Gurung settlement features stone houses, terraced fields, and rich cultural heritage. Ghandruk serves as popular stop on Annapurna treks and offers homestay experiences.

details.subtitle: Gurkha Heritage
details.text: Many local families have Gurkha military tradition

details.subtitle: Architecture
details.text: Stone houses designed to withstand earthquakes

details.subtitle: Community Tourism
details.text: Model for village-based sustainable tourism

details.subtitle: Cultural Preservation
details.text: Gurung Museum preserves local traditions

travelTips: Pack warm clothes - chilly at night

places.name: Tatopani Hot Springs
places.description: Natural thermal springs along Kali Gandaki River near Annapurna Circuit.
places.detail: The name 'Tatopani' means 'hot water' in Nepali. These sulfur-rich springs (temperature around 40Â°C) provide perfect relaxation after trekking, with views of steep canyon walls.

details.subtitle: Ancient Use
details.text: Used by traders and pilgrims for centuries

details.subtitle: Geothermal Activity
details.text: Caused by same tectonic forces that created Himalayas

details.subtitle: Trekker's Oasis
details.text: Popular rest stop on Annapurna Circuit

details.subtitle: Therapeutic Value
details.text: Believed to relieve muscle pain and skin conditions

travelTips: Avoid if you have open wounds
Combine with visit to nearby Ghasa village

places.name: Upper Mustang
places.description: Forbidden Kingdom preserving Tibetan culture in arid Himalayan landscape.
places.detail: This restricted area near Tibetan border features dramatic canyons, ancient cave monasteries, and whitewashed houses. The capital Lo Manthang (3,840m) contains medieval palaces and Buddhist art.

details.subtitle: Kingdom History
details.text: Was independent Buddhist kingdom until 2008

details.subtitle: Restricted Access
details.text: Opened to foreigners only in 1992 with strict limits

details.subtitle: Cultural Preservation
details.text: One of last places preserving traditional Tibetan culture

details.subtitle: Geological Interest
details.text: Contains important fossil beds from Tethys Sea era

travelTips: Respect photo restrictions in religious sites

places.name: Davis Falls
places.description: Unique waterfall disappearing underground in Pokhara.
places.detail: Also known as Patale Chhango, this waterfall plunges into an underground tunnel during monsoon. The adjacent Gupteshwor Cave contains a sacred Shiva shrine behind the falling water.

details.subtitle: Name Origin
details.text: Named after Swiss tourist Davi who drowned here in 1961

details.subtitle: Geological Formation
details.text: Created by seismic activity that shifted river course

details.subtitle: Tourist Attraction
details.text: Most visited site in Pokhara after Phewa Lake

details.subtitle: Religious Site
details.text: Cave temple attracts Hindu pilgrims

travelTips: Combine with nearby Tibetan refugee camp visit

places.name: Rupa Lake
places.description: Tranquil freshwater lake surrounded by fishing villages and hills.
places.detail: The third largest lake in Pokhara Valley, Rupa offers pristine nature and birdwatching opportunities. The area supports organic farming and community-based tourism initiatives.

details.subtitle: Agricultural Importance
details.text: Traditional fish farming dates back centuries

details.subtitle: Geological Formation
details.text: Formed by tectonic movement like Phewa and Begnas

details.subtitle: Eco-Tourism
details.text: Model for community-managed sustainable tourism

details.subtitle: Biodiversity
details.text: Important habitat for migratory birds
